title: [GAMEPLAY] Teemo's Q is bugged.

embed.description: Create & discover new Champion builds/strategies, check your Summoner statistics and try our powerful LoL charts.

body:
I have played a lot of Teemo over the years, and have always noticed a problem with his blind. When Teemo Q's something and applies blind the enemies first auto attack will still do damage. This is most obvious if you Teemo jungle, but it also leads to many needless deaths against players.

One auto attack may not seem like much, but it can make a big difference in certain situations.{{champion:17}}

replies.body:
Thanks for the report! :D

This is a known issue. I'll poke some peeps about this.
I think its Blind in general, I sometimes Blind people with Quinn and the first autoattack goes through still.
it is blind in general. I just replied to LoveStrut with more details about it.
I appreciate the riot response! :)

Unfortunately, this is not a real bug. I brought this up to Phreak in a topic once.

Blind currently opperates on the next aa if the enemy is struck at any time during their current aa animation. This is how all the old atk spd buffs/debuffs worked back in the day when blind was programmed. A few years back, riot re-coded atkspd buffs/debuffs to apply instantly, but never saw the need to do so for blind.

When I brought it up to Phreak, he was actually against bringing it in line to work like atkspd buffs/debuffs and thought it was perfectly fine as is.

I disagree.
Except if you use Q on a jungle camp it's first attack hits you. If the Q is initiating the fight the monster should not have an attack animation Queued up.

interesting. maybe it has something to do with way the dmg and status effects are applied. Like, if the dmg is applied even a fraction of a second before the status effect, then that let's the jungle mob queue up an aa. I dunno, but it's probably very technical.

Either way, I'd really like to see it brought up to speed with other aa affecting status effects.
If they reprogram it this way the last auto should hit once blind is finished.
and I'd be perfectly fine with that.
I'VE MADE SO MANY POSTS ABOUT THIS, BUT YET NOBODY HAS NOTICED!!!!! D;   Playing Quinn is so annoying when the blind doesn't work.

Speaking of Teemo, could you ask where he is on the list of Rework Priorities. You know with counterplay being a big part of LoL's design. (I'm not talking about his Ult, though that has even lower counter-ability with oracles elixir gone)

Teemo is fine. Hell, the addition of the scuttle crabs took away his best shroom locations anyway. Not gonna say a rework wouldn't maybe be interesting, but in a world of AD casters without mana like Riven/Gnar, he is hardly OP. He's squishy to the point of being a pushover against many of the current meta tops, and if you try to take him support or mid, the tears from your own team will drown the Baron.

The reason he needs a rework is the same reason that AP Sion and to a lesser extent Soraka and Cass had to be reworked or looked at. What is the counterplay to a 80 / 125 / 170 / 215 / 260 (+ 80% AP) point click Ranged nuke every few seconds that prevents the player from doing an action (be it AA or abilities). Thats why AP Sion had to be reworked and why Soraka lost her single target silence. 

HE IS NOT OP! It's that his kit has little counterplay in general and is frustrating to the point of Ryze and old Cass (she was mostly fine IMO) levels of lane denial where they don't even allow the opponent to farm at all even under tower in most cases due in part to high base damage or range. With the change of NMM from 400g to 500g he gained a lot more power in his early harrass as the opponent only has masteries and Runes for MR. His Toxic shot power 34 / 68 / 102 / 136 / 170 (+ 70% AP) allows very early lane control against lower ranged opponents (the melee vs ranged problem) and there is nothing one can do to counter it until one has Spectre's Cowl (which was reduced in effectiveness this season). The whole few if any retaliation possibilities is why Ryze had his Q nerfed (and is on the rework list), AP Sion was removed, and why Cass and Soraka were reworked. 

Counterplay is something that Riot themselves have said is a huge concern for the game in its present state. They have even said before that Teemo has low to no counterplay but isn't on the priority rework list as he is not a popular or a overpowered champion. They said that he is a Sion level rework but because he doesn't dominate the game or disrupt balance (they cited low win rate) and that he will be dealt with in time, this was stated back in Season 3 that's why i'm asking.

I think ppl are getting a little too obsessed with "counter play" you don't need counter play on -everything-

There is a point where you can have too much counter play, and I'd say riot is starting to head in that direction. There's something to be said about simplicity. I'm tired of seeing all these new champ kits with nothing but skill shots and conditionals. I really just want another simple champ with an easy to use kit that I don't need to put much thought into so that I can actually focus on what IS important, like lane pressure, positioning, and rotations.

> [{quoted}](name=Corvic Maractis,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=jBUJOuQ4,comment-id=0001000100020000,timestamp=2015-01-23T09:07:36.372+0000)
>
> The reason he needs a rework is the same reason that AP Sion and to a lesser extent Soraka and Cass had to be reworked or looked at. What is the counterplay to a 80 / 125 / 170 / 215 / 260 (+ 80% AP) point click Ranged nuke every few seconds that prevents the player from doing an action (be it AA or abilities). Thats why AP Sion had to be reworked and why Soraka lost her single target silence. 
> 
> HE IS NOT OP! It's that his kit has little counterplay in general and is frustrating to the point of Ryze and old Cass (she was mostly fine IMO) levels of lane denial where they don't even allow the opponent to farm at all even under tower in most cases due in part to high base damage or range. With the change of NMM from 400g to 500g he gained a lot more power in his early harrass as the opponent only has masteries and Runes for MR. His Toxic shot power 34 / 68 / 102 / 136 / 170 (+ 70% AP) allows very early lane control against lower ranged opponents (the melee vs ranged problem) and there is nothing one can do to counter it until one has Spectre's Cowl (which was reduced in effectiveness this season). The whole few if any retaliation possibilities is why Ryze had his Q nerfed (and is on the rework list), AP Sion was removed, and why Cass and Soraka were reworked. 
> 
> Counterplay is something that Riot themselves have said is a huge concern for the game in its present state. They have even said before that Teemo has low to no counterplay but isn't on the priority rework list as he is not a popular or a overpowered champion. They said that he is a Sion level rework but because he doesn't dominate the game or disrupt balance (they cited low win rate) and that he will be dealt with in time, this was stated back in Season 3 that's why i'm asking.

Teemo has plenty of interactivity.

His Q is a nuke (many Q's are), but the CD is 8 seconds long from level 1 to 5, way longer than most other Qs.  Which means he only gets to use it ONCE in most all team fights/encounters.  Once Teemo's blind is gone, he is in trouble.  The Q only affects ONE other champion.  Unlike say Jax, Vlad, Fizz, etc, etc, which counter EVERYONE with some form of invulnerability/untargetable.   Teemo's Q doesn't stop someone from using abilities.  For example, Annie can melt Teemo, blind or no blind.

His E is no more oppressive than any other marksmen.  AD Marksmen get 100% AD damage without the need of specific itemizations or masteries.  Teemo only gets around 50% AP on hit, but REQUIRES specific itemization and masteries to reach that level.  His E gives him sustained damage that is actually less than the sustained damage of a typical AD marksmen (Assuming AP Teemo, which is the typical build).  His on hit E damage actually needs a small buff to get him more inline of a typical ADC (and that's not compensating for lack of crit damage)

Just because Teemo counter's Auto-Attackers, doesn't mean he needs reworked.  He is likewise crushed by ability casters, bursters, gap closers, and just about any form of light cc.

His kit is fine, just needs a buff to compensate for his huge shroom nerf.

> [{quoted}](name=Cornerstone1,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=jBUJOuQ4,comment-id=00010001000200000001,timestamp=2015-01-23T15:38:39.032+0000)

> 
> His kit is fine, just needs a buff to compensate for his huge shroom nerf.

{{champion:17}}  does not need a buff

if you think so you are playing him wrong!

> [{quoted}](name=Corvic Maractis,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=jBUJOuQ4,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2015-01-22T19:59:05.771+0000)
>
> Speaking of Teemo, could you ask where he is on the list of Rework Priorities. You know with counterplay being a big part of LoL's design. (I'm not talking about his Ult, though that has even lower counter-ability with oracles elixir gone)

In Oracle's Elixir's place, you get a FREE red trinket, or you can upgrade the green trinket to a pink one.  Either way, it doesn't take up a main item slot and can be available for free.  So in actuality, it has MORE counter-ability (also the Scuttler nerfs his river placement by tons).

~GL

ps- in ARAM you can also get a Hextech Sweeper or a Lightbringer, and they both are always on radius.

The "FREE" Oracles lens allows a player to check an area around them for 10s every 75s for 475g at level 9. While Elixir gave vision around you for 4mins for 400g each, and was lost if you died. To equal that 4mins of time a player would have to be in the game 50mins past level 9. Low attack speed champions also have it worse than before as the duration (10s) only allows them to kill one or maybe 2 shrooms before the duration ends. 

The addition of Scuttle only prevents him from allowing his team complete baron or dragon area control. It doesnt effect the better players who use his shrooms as wards and anti ganking mechanisms.

I even said his ult is not the problem.

> [{quoted}](name=Corvic Maractis,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=jBUJOuQ4,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2015-01-22T19:59:05.771+0000)
>
> Speaking of Teemo, could you ask where he is on the list of Rework Priorities. You know with counterplay being a big part of LoL's design. (I'm not talking about his Ult, though that has even lower counter-ability with oracles elixir gone)

Personally I think his third ability should be made into an active steroid ability or something.
IMO this isnt a bug, i have noticed this happening only when their AA is already post-windup. they wernt blind when they aimed the projectile so they didnt miss XD .
Except if you use Q on a jungle camp it's first attack hits you. If the Q is initiating the fight the monster should not have an attack animation Queued up.
I hope you dont poke them with teemos blind :V!
I think we should remove targetted Blinds from the game

I reported this once and the community told me I was wrong or that I was seeing AAs that were already launched.

I've seen it completely fail, where multiple AAs after blind do full damage and I die to AAs from ADCs.
Just recently a Cait aa'd me twice and killed me with the blind debuff displayed on her.
Exactly! Without blind working teemo is just squishy with annoying shrooms.

oooh,
so you like playing with the devil?

I've noticed Teemo's blind acting strange in the jungle as well.  I also suspect that the duration of the blind is effectively reduced because the duration starts the instant you press q.  This first auto-attack that bypasses the blind is *STILL* taking up precious duration time of the blind.
i just noticed that yesterday playing against an irelia

I've noticed this playing against garen. I will blind him but his q will still deal damage to me. I know that the silence goes through but the damage shouldn't since garen's q just makes his next auto do more damage and silience.
Good

Well seeing as the champion has already swung/fired/whatever, dunno, blind shouldn't matter?

or maybe I'm just misunderstanding. i stupid. or the Lee Sin theory
This has been happening since like season 3, people now just noticed it?
How come {{champion:64}} can aa people when he's always blind, but all other champs can't aa when they're blind?

I think it has to do with how auto attacks are. I've been experimenting with Jungle Quinn a lot lately, and whenever I blind a monster with an extremely long attack animation the first attack almost always goes through, while if I blind the monster *before* the animation cycle starts it will be blinded.
Replace Blind's 'AAs miss' effect with graves/noc style vision range reduction.  Adjust duration accordingly.  Bam.  Fixed.
can we just remove blind altogether and replace it with something else? Like a hallucinate? It's either OP or utterly useless.
Blinds are awesome.  I want MORE variation of hard CC, not less.
